thread.title: Google injects cash into luxury OTA
thread.title_full: Google injects cash into luxury OTA

title: Google injects cash into luxury OTA
text:
Google’s European investment arm has thrown its weight behind luxury OTA Secret Escapes. 
Google Ventures has reportedly led a £38 million fundraising, according to the Sunday Times . 
It has linked up with venture capital players Octopus, Index and Atlas to inject cash into the five-year-old business. 
Revenues at the company have grown by more than 70% year-on-year, and it now has around 15 million registered members, with 230 staff and offices in Berlin, Warsaw, Stockholm and New York. 
Secret Escapes chief executive and co-founder Alex Saint said: “We spend our whole time looking forward and thinking about how to make this bigger and better”. 
The company has also bought its German and Polish rivals. 
“We will start to look seriously at Asia for acquisitions and growth,” Saint added. “The wonderful things is that business has followed the same path in every country in which we have launched. It gives you the confidence to invest in multiple territories. 
Last year Secret Escapes, which has raised more than £14 million from angel investors and venture capitalists spent some £17 million on advertising, and is planning to spend more than £25 million this year. 
The new investment is the fifth by Google Ventures since it bought its £100 million fund to London in October, the newspaper added.
